abstract: The new government may be using the aggressive reporting to demonstrate a commitment to transparency and accountability as well as use this crisis to further the difficult reforms toward a more sustainable development model, the author writes.

lead_paragraph: Last week’s column discussed the Southern Weekend censorship mess. The incident appears to have fizzled with no significant retreat by the censors or penalties for the journalists involved. A recent podcast, whose guests include Ian Johnson of The New York Times Beijing bureau, provides a good overview of the resolution and possible ramifications of the story.

headline.main: Questions About China’s Growth, Censorship and Air Pollution
